entry.message: [info] Activation of plug-in DQC Rules Validator successful, version Check version using Tools->DQC->Version on the GUI or --dqc-version on the command line. - validate/DQC
[info] Activation of plug-in SEC Inline Transforms successful, version 1.0.0.178. - transforms/SEC
[info] Xule version: 3.0.22727 -
[info] loaded in 2.50 secs at 2019-03-22T11:53:34 - https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1072627/000107262718000155/kfs-20180930.xml

[DQC.US.0044.7503] The concept us-gaap:GainLossOnSaleOfStockInSubsidiaryOrEquityMethodInvestee with a value of -1,001,000 is an accrual-based item in the US GAAP taxonomy that is included in the sum of cash provided by (used in) investing activities in the cash flows of the extension taxonomy.
Accrual-based concepts do not belong and should not be included in the investing section of the cash flows statement of the extension taxonomy. We have seen this problem occur for a couple of reasons. 1. The company has used an item that is an accrual item that would normally be in the income statement or shareholders equity and has used it as a replacement for a cashflow element. These are different concepts and should not be interchanged. This can occur for operating cashflow items where a reconciliation to net income is presented. 2. In other cases we have seen the filer use the sum of investing cash flows to represent operating cash flows. This is an element selection error that sometime occurs and is easily addressed by replacing either the element NetCashProvidedByUsedInInvestingActivitiesContinuingOperations or NetCashProvidedByUsedInInvestingActivities with the operating cash flow item.
If case one above applies replace us-gaap:GainLossOnSaleOfStockInSubsidiaryOrEquityMethodInvestee with an appropriate US GAAP taxonomy cash flows item, if available or, if not, consider extending a concept. Alternatively if case two applies then replace the investing activities parent with the operating activities parent.
The properties of this us-gaap:GainLossOnSaleOfStockInSubsidiaryOrEquityMethodInvestee fact are: Period :2018-01-01 to 2018-09-30 Dimensions : Unit : USD Entity : ('http://www.sec.gov/CIK', '0001072627')
Rule Element Id:7503 Rule version: 9.0.0RC1 - https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1072627/000107262718000155/kfs-20180930.xml 4099

property.name: label
property.value: Gain (Loss) on Disposition of Stock in Subsidiary or Equity Method Investee

entry.message:
[DQC.US.0067.7644] The filing has reported a value of "7,655,000" for the element us-gaap:MaintenanceRevenue. This is a revenue recognition element that is not a component of FASB 606 and does not appear in disclosure group 606000. However the following elements have also been tagged in the filing that indicate that the FASB 606 revenue recognition standard has been adopted: ContractWithCustomerLiability, DisaggregationOfRevenueTableTextBlock, RevenueFromContractWithCustomerTextBlock, RevenueRemainingPerformanceObligationExpectedTimingOfSatisfactionPeriod
Either the new revenue recognition elements must be used or the old revenue recognition elements should be used but they should not be combined in the same filing.
The properties of this us-gaap:MaintenanceRevenue fact are: Period :2018-01-01 to 2018-06-30 Dimensions : Unit : USD
Rule Element Id:7644 Rule version: 9.0.0RC1 - https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1072627/000107262718000155/kfs-20180930.xml 4364

[DQC.US.0081.9277] The line item concept us-gaap:PreferredStockDividendsIncomeStatementImpact with a value of 213,000 is represented as a child of us-gaap:NetIncomeLoss with a value of -11,185,000 in the companies extension taxonomy role 1002000 - Statement - Consolidated Statement of Operations. The element us-gaap:PreferredStockDividendsIncomeStatementImpact however, is not represented as a component of us-gaap:NetIncomeLoss in the US-GAAP taxonomies. The US-GAAP taxonomies include us-gaap:PreferredStockDividendsIncomeStatementImpact as a sibling element (or child of that sibling) relative to us-gaap:NetIncomeLoss. Please review the element selection to determine that an appropriate element has been used for the parent element us-gaap:NetIncomeLoss and the child element us-gaap:PreferredStockDividendsIncomeStatementImpact.
The properties of this us-gaap:PreferredStockDividendsIncomeStatementImpact fact are:
Period :2017-01-01 to 2017-09-30 Dimensions : Unit : USD
Rule Element Id:9277 Rule version: 9.0.0RC1 - https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1072627/000107262718000155/kfs-20180930.xml 4594
